title: Gushwork bets on AI search for customer leads — and early results are emerging
summary: Gushwork has raised $9 million in a seed round led by SIG and Lightspeed. The startup has seen early customer traction from AI search tools like ChatGPT.

title: Anthropic acquires computer-use AI startup Vercept after Meta poached one of its founders
summary: Seattle-based Vercept developed complex agentic tools, including a computer-use agent that could complete tasks inside applications like a person with a laptop would.

title: Nvidia has another record quarter amid record capex spends

title: OpenAI COO says ads will be ‘an iterative process’
summary: COO Brad Lightcap noted that ads can add to the product experience of users if they are done right. He urged to give OpenAI a few months to see how the company fares in rolling out the product.

title: OpenClaw creator’s advice to AI builders is to be more playful and allow yourself time to improve
summary: Peter Steinberger talks about the creation of his viral AI agent OpenClaw and how being more "playful" makes for a better way to learn AI coding.

title: HPE Expands Juniper PTX Line to Power AI Data Center Fabric
summary: The company says its new line of Juniper PTX routers and server products will enhance enterprise AI infrastructure with low-latency, high-capacity, AI-native solutions.

title: Have hard-won scaling lessons to share? Take the stage at TechCrunch Founder Summit 2026
summary: Apply to speak at TechCrunch Founder Summit 2026 by April 17 for a chance to lead a roundtable or breakout session for 1,000 founders and investors. If you’ve built, backed, or operated inside high-growth startups, your experience could shape how the next wave of founders scales.

title: About 12% of US teens turn to AI for emotional support or advice
summary: General-purpose tools like ChatGPT, Claude, and Grok are not designed for this use, making mental health professionals wary.

title: US tells diplomats to lobby against foreign data sovereignty laws
summary: The Trump administration has ordered U.S. diplomats to lobby against countries' attempts to regulate how American tech companies handle foreigners' data.

title: Jira’s latest update allows AI agents and humans to work side by side
summary: Atlassian is unveiling "agents in Jira," which gives users the ability to assign and manage work given to AI agents the same as humans.

title: Adobe Firefly’s video editor can now automatically create a first draft from footage
summary: Adobe Firefly is getting a new feature called Quick Cut that uses AI to edit footage to create a first draft of the final video based on user instructions.

title: How Data Centers Are Adapting to Extreme Weather
summary: From Texas to São Paulo, data center operators are adopting smarter site selection, resilient design, and operations playbooks to withstand extreme heat, flooding, and grid stress.

title: AMD, Meta Strike $100B, 6 GW Chip Deal as AI Race Heats Up
summary: The companies’ agreement is another major challenge to GPU king Nvidia in the high-stakes global AI arms race.

title: Designing for What’s Next: Data Center CEO Priorities in 2026
summary: Leaders must design infrastructure not for current needs but for future demands, with a focus on high-density workloads, strategic planning, and community engagement.

title: Soluna CEO on Stranded Renewables, AI Data Centers, and a 'Grid Revolution'
summary: The green energy data center firm is using untapped renewable energy to spark a new wave of AI data centers that promote grid efficiency.

title: How Data Centers Are Transforming Waste Heat Into Efficiency Gains
summary: Data center waste heat is no longer a byproduct to discard. Discover how innovative designs are turning it into energy efficiency and community benefits.

title: Data Center Rush Spurs Earnings Windfall for Power-Gear Makers
summary: Orders for Vertiv, Eaton, and GE Vernova surged in the final quarter of last year, driven by ballooning data center demand.

title: Logix Ramps Up Fiber Networks as Texas Data Centers Boom
summary: This expansion positions Logix to meet the growing bandwidth demands of AI and cloud computing, as Texas emerges as a leading data center market driven by relaxed regulations, abundant land, and access to energy.
